subSubSection.paragraph:
Proceedings of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences 35: 435 ( Thaxter 1900 )
. –

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type
: [Not designated] [Ind. loc.] “
On
Philonthus longicornis Steph.
, British Museum, No. 408, Island of St. Helena ; on
Philonthus sp.
indet., Hope Coll., No. 225, British Isles. On abdomen and elytra”; FH .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Occurs on
Philonthus
and related genera (
Bisnius Stephens, 1829
,
Gabrius
,
Spatulonthus Tottenham, 1955
, etc.) mostly collected in horse and cow dung. A very common and widespread species that has been reported from Europe, Africa, America and Asia (
Santamaria et al. 1991
; Majewski 2008 ). Recent records are from Ecuador , Kenya and South Africa ( Proaño Castro & Rossi 2008 ), Denmark ( Høier 2009 ), Slovakia and Czech Republic (
Rossi et al. 2010
).
